view.about.Title: About
view.about.Text: Q-TSI (Quantifying Teacher-Student Interactions) supplies researchers with a simple yet rich QFO (Quantitative Field Observation) tool to document teacher-student interactions in the classroom in real-time. The observation protocol is adapted based on early, validated teacher-student interaction frameworks designed and studied by Brophy & Good (1969) and Reyes & Fennema (1981). The app was originally developed for studying the effects of 1:1 computing in the classroom on teacher-student interactions during lessons/activities. This issue has been studied as part of ARTIAC (Affective Role of the Teachers in the Information Age Classroom) Project, at the School of Education, Tel Aviv University (Israel), PI: Dr. Arnon Hershkovitz. The design and development of that protocol and of this app has been an integral part of that project, which was generously funded by the European Commission's Marie Curie Career Integration Grant (CIG) 618511/ARTIAC. The original versions of the protocol, app were designed with the great help of Mr. Amran Shamaly of Tel Aviv University, as part of his Masters Thesis. The current version was developed by Ms. Michelle Schwartz as part of her Bachelor Thesis in Media Informatics Online at Beuth University of Applied Sciences (Berlin, Germany), guided by Prof. Dr. Agathe Merceron.
view.about.Contact: Please send all inquiries to Arnon Hershkovitz, arnonhe@tauex.tau.ac.il.
